strong.font: Mrs. Perry â€“Â Spanish courses, download and use Duolingo, review, reinforce and extend your spanish knowledge â€“Â Accounting students please email lperry@savanna.k12.ok.us for activities

Mrs. Wilson â€“Â all classes rather than studyisland please visit my.hrw.com and do the lessons assigned, if you do not have internet please contact Mrs. Wilson for assignments, assignments open 4-6-20
Mr. Carson â€“ Please do the last 3 sections of studyisland over Right Triangle Geometry , please contact him via the studyisland messaging application for help and links to youtube videos

font.b: Mr. Bradley â€“ April 6-9 watch OETA Tuesday from 7-8PM , Wednesday 8-9PM NOVA, BBC news nightly, 4/14 gene an intimate history @ 7PM, 4/15 Blood sugar rising 8PM

strong.font: Mr. Murdaugh â€“ see Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â voicesofoklahoma.comÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
Mr. Barr â€“Â watch any history channel show that is period related to topics covered in class, if you have internet please research Richard Nixon presidency, specifically Watergate scandal
Mrs. Patterson - contact Mrs. Reeder for paper packet pick up via appointment only
Mrs. Stacy - studyisland go to HS ELA, English I (OK Academic Standards) any lesson with a 70% accuracy level.Â If you do not have internet pleaseÂ
1. do a book report using a template you already know or draw a T-shirt with a summary - use a book not previously reported over
2. do 1 page journal entries, 1 full page, uncluding a prompt, correct grammar and punctuation and current events
3. short stories by Poe, Faulkner, Twain, Jackson or Hughes that can be found online in pdf format or youtube
contact her for more info if needed

font.span: Starting this week, continue our data collection method we began our last week of school. Using the World Health Organization web site, continue to collect the same COVID-19 data points we were collecting earlier including: Confirmed Cases Worldwide, Confirmed Deaths Worldwide, Confirmed U.S. Cases, and confirmed U.S. Deaths. Every Friday, please make four different data tables for each data point. Your table can be a bar graph or line graph. On the x axis please put the dates and on the y axis please put the number of cases. You can either email me your tables at rtucker@savanna.k12.ok.us or snap a picture and send it in to Mr. Kellogg. We will do this every week along with a lesson on the rest of the organ systems we were planning on covering. Thank you guys, and hope to hear from you soon!

img.style: cursor: pointer; max-width: 100%; outline-color: invert; outline-style: none; outline-width: 0px;

div.div:
Â
During this year we covered Darwinâ€™s theory of Evolution through Natural Selection very extensively. So beginning this week, I want you to take a picture of a (preferably local) species and answer ONE of the following questions about it regarding Natural Selection and how it applies to this species:
Â
1. What are three adaptations that help this species survive?
2. Which method of reproductive selection does this species use and what are its desirable traits?
3. Does this species have any Negative adaptations?
You can email me your species weekly at rtucker@savanna.k12.ok.us or send it to Mr. Kellogg.
Â
Example:Â
Â
Â
Â
Southeastern Cricket
Gryllus campestris
Adaptation: Large hind legs built for covering large distances in a short amount of time for escaping predators, small wings adapted for producing â€œchirpingâ€ noises for communication with others of its species, and very specialized mandibles or mouth parts for masticating or chewing of leafy flora.
Â
6th Science
Â
During this year we covered Darwinâ€™s theory of Evolution through Natural Selection very extensively. So beginning this week, I want you to take a picture of a (preferably local) species and answer ONE of the following questions about it regarding Natural Selection and how it applies to this species:
Â
1. What are three adaptations that help this species survive?
Â
You can email me your species weekly at rtucker@savanna.k12.ok.us or send it to Mr. Kellogg.
Â
Example:Â
Â
Â
Â
Southeastern Cricket
Gryllus campestris
Â
Adaptation: Large hind legs built for covering large distances in a short amount of time for escaping predators, small wings adapted for producing â€œchirpingâ€ noises for communication with others of its species, and very specialized mandibles or mouth parts for masticating or chewing of leafy flora.

span.font: To order yearbook or recognition ads for an 8thÂ or 12thÂ â€‹grader.

p.strong: Please know we will continue to support your child with their individual needs during this distance learning time.Â The local plans for each district, across the state will be different than anything they, or you have ever experienced! The changes may be very difficult for some students to manage, and very easy for others.Â First and foremost, know we are here to help you.Â We are all in this together! Someone from the school will contact you to discuss the individual plan for your child. If a teacher has not contacted you, it will happen soon.Â Please contact the school if you have any questions.Â We may not have a current phone number or email address for you.Â If this may be an issue for you, please contact the school, and update the information we have.
Remember, you were your childâ€™s FIRST teacherâ€¦together, WE GOT THIS!
Thank you for working with us.Â We will come out stronger and wiser for the situation.

strong.font: Savanna School plans to administer the ACT test in spring 2020 to eligibile juniors as part of the contract with the OSDE and ACT.Â Over 95% of Oklahoma schools selected to administer the ACT.Â Our District believes it is an excellent opportunity for all eligible juniors to take the ACT at no cost to them or their family.Â Please contact the school if you have any questions about why we chose the ACT at 918-548-3777.

span.strong: Look at our 2017 School Profile under Quick Links to the left

span.span: to check out this issue of Nutrition Nuggets

span.strong: Â to viewÂ Bond Transparency Act of 2017 Information

hr.p: With changing times in education, the Oklahoma State department of Education would like to inform parents about child find opportunities. "All children with disabilities, residing in the State, whether attending public or private schools, should be identified, located, and evaluated.â€ In Oklahoma we require that child find apply to all children who are suspected of having a disability and in need of special education.and related services. We want to make everyone aware of this service that is provided to children with disabilities free of charge throughout the State of Oklahoma. If you would like more information on child find, contact:
